A triangle and a trapezoid are equal in area. They also have the same altitude. If the base of the triangle is $ 18$ inches, the median of the trapezoid is:\\
$ \textbf{(A)}\ 36\text{ inches} \qquad\textbf{(B)}\ 9\text{ inches} \qquad\textbf{(C)}\ 18\text{ inches}\\
\textbf{(D)}\ \text{not obtainable from these data} \qquad\textbf{(E)}\ \text{none of these}$
